titleproper.value:
Guide to the Emery Roth Architectural Print Collection
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1926-1947</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num></num>
                    <num>PR 170</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jenny Gotwals

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-11-10T14:54-0500</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: 53 photomechanical prints showing both interior and exterior views of buildings in New York City designed by Emery Roth.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in Print Room for details.
This collection should be cited as Emery Roth Architectural Print Collection, PR 170, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

Emery Roth (1871-1948) worked as an architect in New York City under his own name from 1898 to 1938, and after 1938 worked with his two sons as Emery Roth & Sons. Roth was a specialist in the field of apartment house design. He designed many notable and fashionable New York residential buildings including the San Remo apartment house, the Oliver Cromwell, Dorset, and Drake apartment hotels, the Ritz Tower, and the St. Moritz hotel.

Buildings shown are mainly apartment houses and hotels, with a few religious facilities and office buildings. Few of the prints have dates, but those from photographs are all post construction. Many of the buildings shown here were completed in the second half of the 1920s.

subject.value: Apartment houses -- New York (State) -- New York
Architecture -- New York (State) -- New York -- Designs and plans
Commercial buildings -- New York (State) -- New York
